title: English striker Louie Barry finally makes competitive debut for Barcelona youth team
text:
English teenager Louie Barry made his long-awaited competitive debut for Barcelona on Saturday after finally receiving clearance from FIFA.

The 16-year-old, wearing the no.16 shirt, came on as a second half substitute as Barca's Juvenil A team beat San Francisco 2-0 at the Ciutat Esportiva Joan Gamper.

Winger Jaume Jardi scored both goals in the win.

Teenager Louie Barry made his long-awaited competitive debut for Barcelona on Saturday

Barcelona signed striker from West Brom in July to play in their Under-19 team, known at U19A.

A hold up with paperwork had delayed Barry's registration with Barcelona.

The youngster turned down the offer of a professional contract with West Brom to continue his football education with the famous Spanish side. PSG were also in the hunt for one of the most promising starlets in Europe but Barry chose Barcelona.

Barry was at West Brom from the age of six and was tipped to make the step up to their first team.

Louie Barry signed for Barcelona after rejecting a professional contract with West Brom

But the quality of his performances for Albion and England have caught the attention of scouts from across Europe.

Last year he scored 10 goals in five games for England U15s during a tournament in Italy.

Barcelona will pay the Baggies in the region of £235,000 in compensation.
